content.raw:
That had been done on purpose to prevent the user from opening several loggers or closing a logger while it is recording, but I realize it didn't accomplish the second task because the user could still click the dialog's close button while recording. As of 3948b30:

* The logger stays on top of the main window even if it loses focus

* Unchecking the button closes the dialog

* Closing the dialog while it is recording stops recording
content.html:
That had been done on purpose to prevent the user from opening several loggers or closing a logger while it is recording, but I realize it didn't accomplish the second task because the user could still click the dialog's close button while recording. As of 3948b30:

  • The logger stays on top of the main window even if it loses focus

  • Unchecking the button closes the dialog

  • Closing the dialog while it is recording stops recording

pull_request.title: Move data logger to the toolbar

pullrequest.title: Move data logger to the toolbar

content.raw: In any case, this question brought to my attention that a new instance of `DataLogger` is being created each time the user starts logging. I changed the logic on 3948b30 and now a single instance is created in the constructor.
content.html: In any case, this question brought to my attention that a new instance of DataLogger is being created each time the user starts logging. I changed the logic on 3948b30 and now a single instance is created in the constructor.

pullrequest.title: Move data logger to the toolbar

content.raw:
The whole thing seems to work for me. One comment about usability:

 * Gazebo maximized in the whole screen
 * I press the new of log, the recording window appears on top of Gazebo windows, nice
 * Don't ask me why, but I press again the checked log button to close the recording window
 * The button remains checked but the window was not closed and instead is now behind the gazebo window (standard behaviour of the window manager yes).

I leave to your consideration if we need to change it or it is just fine how it is.
content.html:
The whole thing seems to work for me. One comment about usability:

  • Gazebo maximized in the whole screen
  • I press the new of log, the recording window appears on top of Gazebo windows, nice
  • Don't ask me why, but I press again the checked log button to close the recording window
  • The button remains checked but the window was not closed and instead is now behind the gazebo window (standard behaviour of the window manager yes).

I leave to your consideration if we need to change it or it is just fine how it is.
